page.title: 16FORESTRY
page.content: Beecraigs country park has 500 acres of trees.Most of the trees are coniferous they are Norway spruce, sitka , silverfir spruce,lodgepole pine, hemlock and larch. Several forestry workers care for the trees and work at thinning out the thickest areas and planting young trees in other parts of the forest. There is a sawmill very near the park where the wood from the park is turned into fence posts. Some parts of the park have broad leaved trees such as beech, birch, sycamore, and elder growing. This part of the woodland provides a home for many birds and grey squirrels. Badgers ,foxes and roe deer also live in the wooded places in the park. There are several way_marked walks through the woods.
